hook.text: Before Marcus Aurelius made Stoicism famous, it was born in Athens around 300 BCE.

buildup.text: Zeno of Citium founded Stoicism, teaching at the Stoa Poikile â€” the 'painted porch' â€” in the Athenian agora.

discovery.text: Core teachings: live according to nature, accept what you can't control, and cultivate virtue above all else.

twist.text: Early Stoics had a complete system: logic, physics, and ethics. Most people today only know the ethics.

climax.text: Stoicism traveled from Greek academia to Roman emperors to modern self-help. Its journey spans two millennia.

punchline.text: Born on a porch in Athens. Still taught around the world.
